department.en: Department of Computer Science and Elec. Engineering

goal.en: Study theoretical and practical knowledge of multimedia data compression and signal processing.
goal.ch: 學習多媒體壓縮之理論與實務暨訊號處理

content.en:
“1. Introduction: lossless and lossy data compression; modelling and coding; entropy and source coding theorem
2. Lossless compression
I. Huffman Coding: uniquely decodable codes; Huffman Codes; dynamic Huffman coding; applications.
II. Arithmetic Coding: implementation details; adaptive arithmetic coding; applications.
III. Dictionary Method: static dictionary codes; Lempel-Ziv coding; LZ 77/78 and their variations; implementation and applications.
3. Lossy compression
I. Scalar/Vector Quantization Non-uniform quantizer; Lloyd algorithm; LBG Algorithm; tree structure VQ; search methods for nearest neighbor encoding; variations and applications.
II. Still image compression: JPEG/JPEG2000, EZW, SPIHT
III. Video compression: MPEG, H.264
IV. Audio compression: MP3
“
content.ch:
“1. Introduction: lossless and lossy data compression; modelling and coding; entropy and source coding theorem
2. Lossless compression
I. Huffman Coding: uniquely decodable codes; Huffman Codes; dynamic Huffman coding; applications.
II. Arithmetic Coding: implementation details; adaptive arithmetic coding; applications.
III. Dictionary Method: static dictionary codes; Lempel-Ziv coding; LZ 77/78 and their variations; implementation and applications.
3. Lossy compression
I. Scalar/Vector Quantization Non-uniform quantizer; Lloyd algorithm; LBG Algorithm; tree structure VQ; search methods for nearest neighbor encoding; variations and applications.
II. Still image compression: JPEG/JPEG2000, EZW, SPIHT
III. Video compression: MPEG, H.264
IV. Audio compression: MP3
“

textbook.en:
“1. Thomas M. Cover and Joy A. Thomas, ““Elements of Information Theory,““ 2nd Edition, Wiley-Interscience Publication, John Wiley ＆ Sons, Inc., 2006.
2. Timothy Bell, John Cleary, Ian Witten, ““Text Compression,““ 1990.
3. William B. Pennebaker, Joan L. Mitchell, ““JPEG: Still Image Data Compression Standard““, 1992.
4. Iain E.G. Richardson, ““H.264 and MPEG-4,““ Wiley, 2003.
5. David Taubman, Michael Marcellin, ““JPEG2000: Image Compression Fundamentals, Standards and Practice““, 2001.
6. Allen Gersho, R. and Robert M. Gray, ““Vector Quantization and Signal Compression,““ Klumer Acad. Pub. 1992.
7. David Salomon, ““Handbook of Data Compression,““ 5th Edi. Springer, 2010.
8. J. Arnold, M. Frater and M. Pickering, ““Digital Television – Technology and Standards,““ Wiley-Interscience Publication, John Wiley ＆ Sons, Inc., 2007.
“
textbook.ch:
“1. Thomas M. Cover and Joy A. Thomas, ““Elements of Information Theory,““ 2nd Edition, Wiley-Interscience Publication, John Wiley ＆ Sons, Inc., 2006.
2. Timothy Bell, John Cleary, Ian Witten, ““Text Compression,““ 1990.
3. William B. Pennebaker, Joan L. Mitchell, ““JPEG: Still Image Data Compression Standard““, 1992.
4. Iain E.G. Richardson, ““H.264 and MPEG-4,““ Wiley, 2003.
5. David Taubman, Michael Marcellin, ““JPEG2000: Image Compression Fundamentals, Standards and Practice““, 2001.
6. Allen Gersho, R. and Robert M. Gray, ““Vector Quantization and Signal Compression,““ Klumer Acad. Pub. 1992.
7. David Salomon, ““Handbook of Data Compression,““ 5th Edi. Springer, 2010.
8. J. Arnold, M. Frater and M. Pickering, ““Digital Television – Technology and Standards,““ Wiley-Interscience Publication, John Wiley ＆ Sons, Inc., 2007.
“

grading.en:

2. Midterm exam: 25％
3. Final exam: 25％
4. Term report 20％
“
